You probably love Prada, Louis Vuitton, and Chanel replica designer purses but don't know how those famous labels became the leaders in the fashion industry. Knowing a small amount about the backgrounds these design houses can make these purses much more valuable to you.

Prada: A long History in Handbags

Back 1913, Mario Prada proven the Fratelli Prada store in Milan, Italy which often sold leather items, which include handbags. Shockingly, he never approved to do business interactions with women so almost all of his clients were noblemen from through the entire country. Mario died in the 1950's and his daughter-in-law ran the firm for the next 20 years. However it was Mario's little girl Miuccia and her partner Patrizio Bertelli took over the company in 1978. With her, the Prada name started to emerge as one of the great replica designer labels in the world. While Prada had been around for more than eight decades, the name arrived to its own in the 1990's and began to become the ultimate fashion symbol we've all arrived at love.

A long way from Luggage: Louis Vuitton

A long time before Louis Vuitton was synonymous with some of the most beautiful purses available, it's the name of a French man who chosen to walk from Jura to help Paris in 1835. The journey was longer but Vuitton was determined to be happy. Soon after reaching metropolis of Lights, he began creating their own luggage and that luggage would be your foundation of his success. In 1892, Vuitton's son took on the family business. He brought the name to north america just a year later by having an exhibition at the Chicago World's Fair.
